more police in sheffield after gang fights .
people in parts of york to do more to prevent flooding .

police officers nominated for bravery award .

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: well that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow

documents.title: cash offer to residents on hs2 route
text: cash offer to residents on hs2 route

documents.title: listen : police on streets in burngreave
text: we 've been telling you about south yorkshire police 's decision to put a dedicated team in the burngreave area of sheffield .
it follows a rise in community tensions and an increase in crime .
lee kayne is the burngreave problem solving team sergeant for the force and told me how the team will look :
author: Howard Pressman
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: rugby coach jailed for filming in changing rooms
text: a rugby coach has been jailed for molesting young boys and secretly filming them in changing rooms .
david simmons , 26 , formerly of sheffield , planted covert cameras in clocks and a shower gel bottle to film teenage rugby players undress .
nearly 500 videos were found at his ashford home .
simmons pleaded guilty to 17 sexual offences , including sexually assaulting boys under the age of 13 .
he was jailed for three years and eight months at southwark crown court .

documents.title: 'tallest ' owl mural soars over city
text: 'tallest ' owl mural soars over city

documents.title: hs2 residents offered cash incentive
text: residents of a newly-built housing estate in south yorkshire which is due to be on or near the government 's preferred route of the high speed two rail line have been offered cash to stay in their homes .

the government has said the 140 residents of the shimmer estate in mexborough can apply for a minimum of £ 30,000 if they want to stay , which is equivalent to 10 % of their property value or a £ 30,000 minimum .
i recognise that this is a difficult time for shimmer residents and i would like to thank them for their patience and reassure them they will be treated fairly and with compassion . ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: bradford sign accrington 's mccartan
text: bradford sign accrington 's mccartan

documents.title: i can see you ! ! suspect fails to leg it from police
text: some criminals are devious , coldly calculating and dangerously clever .
some however are not , like this suspect in halifax who tried to hide under a bed to escape police .
officers say that they went to a man 's house to arrest him as part of an ongoing operation across calderdale and this was the spot he chose to try and hide in .
turns out it was a bad choice as the 30-year-old , who was wanted after he failed to appear at court for burglary offences , did n't do a very good job of concealing himself .
west yorkshire police said on facebook : `` you will not be surprised to find out that yes we did find him - he will not be winning any awards for hide and seek champion soon ! ! ! ''
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : tramlines tickets 'almost gone '
text: sheffield 's annual tramlines music festival is now three weeks away .
there will be over 70 acts playing across the weekend including all saints , primal scream and the libertines .
here 's a preview of what 's in-store for 2017 :
author: Christian Carlisle
Introducing Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: yorks and surrey draw after washout
text: yorks and surrey draw after washout

documents.title: missing teenager from leeds found in germany
text: a leeds teenager who had gone missing in germany has been found safe and well .
joshua tummons , 19 , had not been seen or heard from for 10 days .

documents.title: search for man , 80 , missing in sheffield
text: have you seen 80-year-old dennis webb ?
he 's been missing from his sheffield home all day .
dennis was last seen at about 09:15 at his home in ecclesall road south .
when his wife returned home this afternoon , dennis was not there .
dennis was wearing navy blue trousers and a zip up coat .
he may also be carrying or using a walking stick , and wearing glasses .

documents.title: vandal damages 29 cars at dealership
text: a used car showroom in the village of kirk hammerton in north yorkshire has been hit by a vandal who has caused about £ 29,000 of damage .
police have released a cctv image of a man they want to speak to about it
the 29 cars are thought to have been been damaged at around 22:30 on sunday 4 june at yorkshire vehicle solutions .
the damage totals about £ 1,000 of paintwork damage to each car .

documents.title: castle howard in bloom 'adds to opulence '
text: the opening day of the castle howard in bloom is underway .
now in its fourth year it 's described as a `` floral displays adding to the opulence '' of the stately home .
organiser , catherine gledhill told me what visitors can expect :
author: Joanita Musisi
BBC Radio York

documents.title: new tv drama is being filmed in sheffield by this is england 's shane meadows
text: acclaimed film director shane meadows is shooting a new tv drama in sheffield and he 's looking for extras to feature in the programme .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: european funding for tv and film projects in yorkshire
text: the government 's given an assurance european funding for tv and film projects in yorkshire will continue up to 2020 .
the issue 's been raised in the house of commons today by labour mp for batley and spen , tracy brabin .
she says yorkshire 's film and tv industry is growing faster than anywhere else in the uk :

documents.title: teenage man raped in rotherham
text: police in rotherham have released a cctv image of a man the want to speak to after an 18-year-old man was raped last week .
officers say that it happened at about 00:10 on 22 june , when the victim was walking in the moorgate street area of the town centre .
police have been reviewing cctv footage to track the victim 's movements and are urging anyone who may know the man in the to get in touch .
we are continuing to offer support to the man and are trying to work with him to gather as much information as possible . ''

documents.title: worker killed in crane collapse was 'devoted daddy '
text: the family of a father-of-three who was killed when a crane collapsed in crewe say he `` touched the hearts of everyone who knew him '' .
david newall , 36 , from bradford was one of two building site workers who died at the site in dunwoody way on 21 june .
the other was rhys barker , 18 , from castleford - post-mortem tests found they died from crush injuries .
cheshire police and the health and safety executive are still investigating .
in a statement , mr newall 's family says he would `` do anything for anyone '' and was a `` devoted daddy '' to his three children .
they add that they want to thank all the emergency services who responded on the night and for the support they 've had since .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cannabis plants seized in wakefield raid
text: this is the scene that greeted police when they raided a house on the outskirts of wakefield this morning
they found a large cannabis farm on coronation street in wrenthorpe just after midnight .
officers had a report of `` sus activity '' at the house and found the plants throughout the house .
the plants were seized and are ready to be destroyed .

documents.title: man left with leg injury in york stabbing
text: armed officers were called to an area of york yesterday afternoon after `` reports of a violent disturbance . ''
it happened at 14:30 on hope street in the city .
a man was taken to hospital for treatment to a leg injury .
officers say that a man in his 30s was arrested in connection with a suspected stabbing incident .

documents.title: clay faces hung to deter selby fly-tippers
text: new clay 'faces ' are being installed at fly tipping hotspots across the selby district in the hope of deterring fly-tippers .
the faces were created as part of the larger do n't be a waster - reduce , reuse , respect campaign to deter fly tippers in the district .
the district council says similar projects elsewhere have seen a reduction in littering by as much as 30 % .
this has been an inventive way to work with a local community group to help tackle behaviour we all find disgraceful . ''

documents.title: travel update : broken down bus causing problems in leeds
text: just in case you were about to hop on a bus in leeds city centre :
leeds - 13:00 - all leeds services - broken down bus blocking the headrow junction with albion street , buses are diverting the city loop
is it one of your buses
no , it 's all our services ^sa
so have all your services got broken down buses on the headrow
all services are affected by this one broken down bus ^sa
do u understand english , was it a first bus that was broken down on the headrow can u not understand my question
i 'll get this checked for you ^sa
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: man arrested after two weeks on the run
text: a man who has been on the run from the police for two weeks and who caused a school to go into lockdown while officers searched for him has been arrested .
daniel brown , 22 , was arrested in wakefield last night after giving officers the slip when he was receiving treatment in hospital .
a 20-year-old man and a 20-year-old woman were also arrested on sus of assisting an offender .
brown was arrested as a direct result of information from the public following our previous appeal and we are very grateful for that assistance . ''

documents.title: hillsborough : 96th victim 's family 'hugely disappointed ' over charge decision
text: the family of tony bland , the keighley labourer who was fatally injured during the hillsborough disaster and died aged 22 almost four years later , have said they are `` hugely disappointed '' at the decision not to charge david duckenfield with his manslaughter .
ninety-six liverpool fans were fatally injured in a crush during the fa cup semi-final held at sheffield wednesday 's stadium on 15 april 1989 .

yesterday , the crown prosecution service announced an intention to charge mr duckenfield , a former chief superintendant who was match commander on the day , with 95 charges of manslaughter by gross negligence .
prosecutors said the law at the time meant if a person died more than one year and one day after they were fatally injured , no-one could be charged in relation to their death .
in a statement , mr bland 's family said :

whilst we are hugely disappointed with the exclusion of tony from the manslaughter charge against david duckenfield by the cps , our relief for the families of the other 95 men , women and children outweigh our personal frustrations .
justice has been achieved following the inquests , when the jury returned the verdict of all 96 victims being unlawfully killed at hillsborough , and nothing will ever change that .
we will continue to support the other families on the journey for accountability , despite tony being excluded from the prosecution of david duckenfield .
we ask you to keep tony in your thoughts as we move on through the next process for accountability .

documents.title: one hundred yorkshire water jobs at risk in bradford and barnsley
text: one hundred jobs are at risk because yorkshire water has decided to pull out of the business service side of their operations .
yorkshire water say they will `` exit the non-household retail market '' which could affect employees in bradford and barnsley .
the company says it only wants to provide services to residential customers in future - and plans to sell off its business division .

documents.title: live : 1,000 school children march to celebrate jo cox
text: more than 1,000 children are taking part in step into the future at batley bulldogs ' stadium , in memory of the late jo cox mp .
if you ca n't be there , why not take a quick look live on facebook :

documents.title: happy birthday to sheffield 's botanical gardens
text: sheffield 's botanical gardens is 181 years old today !
here 's a of how it once looked :

the iconic landmark is gearing up to host this weekend 's music in the gardens , so if you 're going there to see the bootleg beatles , 10cc or the night of music from the movies over the next three nights , make sure you raise a glass to the venue .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: dame judi dench 's childhood teddy comes home to yorkshire
text: a much loved teddy bear that belonged to dame judi dench during her childhood in york has come home .
'bear ' is holidaying in north yorkshire this summer , at the world 's largest collection of famous teddy bears on display at newby hall , near ripon .
it 's the most recent addition to the collection which is on permanent loan to the newby hall charitable trust , near ripon , from broadcaster gyles brandreth .

dame judi 's 'bear ' is joined by another new arrival belonging to actor , thelma ruby , whose bear is an original 1958 sooty presented to her by harry corbett himself , after she starred with him at the leeds city varieties .
gyles brandreth is above welcoming dame judi dench 's 'bear ' to the collection .

documents.title: bake it better 2017
text: schools , offices and coffee groups across sheffield are enjoying a treat or two today to help raise some 'dough ' for sheffield children 's hospital .
the annual bake it better campaign takes place each june and every penny raised goes to the charity to help pay for enhancements that are n't available on the nhs .
here 's some bits that we 've had in so far :
we 'd love to see any of locations that are taking part and you can send them to yorkshirelive @ bbc.co.uk
@ twitterid it 's our bake it better cake sale @ twitterid tomorrow !
ellie spent 11 weeks on nsu and wants to give something back .

just wondering if we can use your photo of bake it better for a bbc online piece ?

no problem !
we will also be posting more later .

# raisesomedough
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: sheffield man jailed for five years for holding a firearm
text: a sawn-off shotgun hidden in an empty rabbit hutch on an allotment plot in sheffield , has resulted in a 21-year-old being sent to prison for five years .
jack brook of penrith road , was charged with possession of a prohibited weapon , after police executed a warrant at allotment plots in shirecliffe in august last year .

south yorkshire police discovered the weapon and a box of ammunition at one of the plots , plus it became apparent the plots were being used to breed dogs , as 21 puppies , 13 german shepherds and eight collies , all less than eight-weeks old , were also found in poor conditions .
the puppies have since been re-homed by the rspca .
i 'm pleased brook is behind bars and a dangerous weapon is now off the streets , out of circulation and unable to fall into anyone else 's hands ''
author: Oliver Wright
BBC News Online, Yorkshire

documents.title: killamarsh sport centre currently closed
text: a sport centre in south sheffield has been forced to close due to a `` critical issue ' with the water system .
killamarsh parish council , which manages the sports centre , has apologised for any inconvenience and has asked customers to call on friday morning for an update on opening times .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: breakingtotley tree protest latest
text: earlier we brought you news that people had gathered in the totley area of sheffield to protest against tree felling on abbeydale park rise .
however , the liberal democrat councillor for dore and totley , joe otten has just posted this on social media :
we 'll keep you updated on bbc radio sheffield with any further developments .
amey withdrawing from abbeydale park rise .
meeting with residents promised .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: chesterfield sign striker o'grady
text: chesterfield sign striker o'grady

documents.title: chain gang makes tracks for yorkshire
text: on the day when some big news for cycling in yorkshire is announced - the county 's been named as the location for one of the most prestigious events on the road cycling calendar - craven council has been quick to give their own regular two-wheeled race a mention .
skipton cycle races are back on wednesday july 5 with some of the world 's best cyclists and it 's free to spectate !

documents.title: a thousand children march for legacy of jo cox
text: more than 1,000 children from schools around batley and birstall are coming together to celebrate the legacy of the late west yorkshire mp jo cox .
this event is all about a celebration of who we are , as young people who are really going to make a difference . ''
the big walk will see the children marching with banners from batley town centre today to the batley bulldogs ground .
once there there they 'll all get together and learn about each other 's cultures .
you can see more later on when there 'll be a facebook live via bbc look north .
she was a very nice lady and she tried to do the best for her community . ''
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: tree protesters gather in totley
text: each christmas abbeydale park rise in the totley area of sheffield decorate the trees in the street with lights to celebrate the festive period .
here 's a video from december 2016 of what the street looks like when lit up :
well , i 'm on the road again today as people gather to protest against those trees being felled .
some of those taking part have been handed `` legal documents '' and had their photographs taken .
sheffield city council has already sent letters to 17 tree protesters warning them of possible legal action if they protest again the felling scheme .
the most christmassy street in sheffield ?
with thanks to ronan sully .
abbeydale park rise @ twitterid
2 houses opposite each other on gosforth drive dronfield
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: how has the smartphone changed your life ?
text: the world ' first smartphone went on sale 10-years-ago today , when apple changed the mobile phone market forever .
no longer was it just about making calls and sending texts , the smartphone meant we could browse the internet or keep up to date with breaking news - you may very well be reading this on one now .
we 've been asking people in harrogate whether the smart phone has changed their lives for the better or the worse :
author: BBC Radio York

documents.title: nine years on and still smiling !
text: reverend kate bottley from sheffield , is celebrating nine years since becoming a vicar .
the googlebox star , who is also a regular on bbc tv and radio , took to social media earlier to share her delight at reaching the milestone :
it 's 9 years since i was ordained , it 's not worked out quite how i expected # petertide
all of us who have been ordained could say much the same thing .
my only caution would be to remember that the media is very fickle .
were you singing 'the hills are alive ' in that first shot ?
does it ever ?
know this though , god is using you in a mighty way sister - keep being you , and keep trusting him .
many congrats .
mysterious ways , remember - mysterious ways !
happy ordainiversary xxx
i think you 're ace !
you are a great blessing to more people than you ever dreamed of !
x
better or worse ?
better ?
god works in mysterious ways !
but it 's working just how god planned i am sure !
it 's better that way x congratulations x
the hills are alive with the sound of katy ( i know you 're kate , but it does n't scan )
2nd looks like it 's from monty python sketch 'the bishop '
congratulations !
better !
they say it 's part of the journey xx
author: Steve Bailey
Sunday Breakfast presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: serious head injury for guiseley crash driver
text: a man has been left with a serious head injury after a crash in guiseley yesterday afternoon .
it happened just before 17:00 on bingley road near to the junction of goose lane .
a silver bmw was being driven along bingley road when it crashed with a silver vauxhall astra travelling along towards guiseley .
the 58-year-old driver of the bmw suffered a serious head injury and was taken to leeds general infirmary for treatment .

documents.title: doncaster museums awarded grant
text: doncaster heritage services , who run cusworth hall and the town 's museum and art gallery on chequer road , have received a grant to help connect visitors with its collection of mining heritage .

the two-year project will work with participants in the ex-mining communities of denaby main , hatfield , stainforth and woodlands to tell the story of the sinking of the deep pits in the area from the early 20th century to the present day .
the project will see older and younger participants work together to curate exhibitions which will be displayed at cusworth hall and in various locations across the borough .
it looks set to be a great experience for all involved .
i look forward to seeing the project take shape . ''
author: Kevin Larkin
Doncaster Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: uk 's tallest mural completed in leeds
text: the uk 's tallest mural has officially been completed in leeds .
it 's been painted on the side of the re-vamped platform building in the city , which stands above the train station .
it 's not been an easy task for the artists , they 've had to go through specialist training to enable them to work at a knee trembling 137ft .
they also had to use a special metre-wide cradle to paint the huge mural and employed a grid system to make sure they painted the right part of the wall .
at 137ft ( 41.9m ) tall , it 's the biggest bit of street art in the country .

documents.title: leeds climate change scientists first to drill everest glacier
text: climate change scientists from the university of leeds and aberystwyth university have become the first to successfully drill through the world 's highest glacier .
the group used a drill adapted from a car wash to cut into the khumbu glacier in the foothills of everest .
working at an altitude of roughly 5,000m ( 16400ft ) , they spent three days drilling 150m ( 492ft ) into the glacier .
its internal structure was then recorded using a 360-degree camera .
the 10.5 mile ( 17km ) long glacier flows from as high as 7,600m ( 25,000ft ) down to 4,900m ( 16,000ft ) and is often used by climbers on their way to everest base-camp .

the six week expedition was a part of the everdrill project , which is collecting data to understand how the glacier moves and changes over time , and how it might respond to anticipated climate change .

documents.title: sheffield keep england 's strongest man title
text: sheffield has made sure the title of england 's strongest man remains in the steel city for the second year running after phil roberts lifted the title at the annual event in kent .
standing at six feet three inches tall and weighing 21 stone , he takes the title from paul smith .
the pair train together at the same gym in arbourthorne .
to win his title the ex-policeman took part in events including moving big tyres :
weightlifting unusual objects and a duel with other competitors :
i started off as a novice , won rotherham 's strongest man 2012 , sheffield 's strongest man 2014 and now i am the new strongest man in england .
you are not born strong you are trained strong . ''
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : lessons in becoming a hornblower
text: if you fancy a change of career , time 's running out for you to apply to be ripon 's new hornblower .
a horn 's been sounded four times in the city 's market place at 21:00 every night since 886ad .
the city council wants a new member of the hornblowing team to work up to three nights a week .
the deadline for applications is monday .
here are a few tips if you 're thinking of applying :

documents.title: tennis funding announced in sheffield
text: people from the lawn tennis association were in sheffield this morning to announce their pledge to put £ 250 million into grass-roots tennis across the uk .
the lta will put £ 125 million into improving existing facilities , with the other half earmarked to grow the game in communities across the country .
it all follows a £ 1.5m pilot scheme in south yorkshire , where the governing body has seen a 54 % increase in people playing the sport .
alastair marks is the lta 's participation director and spoke to bbc breakfast earlier this morning :
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: dressed for the weather ? : stripes optional
text: look north weatherman , owain wyn evans , appears to have some fashionable tips on dressing for the weather .
i think that 's what 's going on anyway !
today : enter thursday in a trance for style !
hypnotise your colleagues and be ready for : showers cloud # outfitoutlook
you really are crackers owain ! ! !
good work !
here 's my # outfitoutlook # whostolesummer
dashing
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: scarborough cctv appeal : fake £ 20 note suspects sought
text: north yorkshire police has released cctv images of four men in connection with an ongoing counterfeit money investigation in scarborough .
the footage was taken at the retail park on seamer road at around 17:00 on 22 february .
the group of men entered a number of stores where they purchased low-cost items using fake £ 20 notes .
police enquiries have been ongoing to identify the men , including possible linked offences in west yorkshire .

documents.title: listen : 'the biggest sporting event ' happening in 2019 in the uk
text: earlier we brought you the news that yorkshire will be the location for the 2019 uci road world championship .
the multi-day event will involve places across the county including harrogate , doncaster and leeds
sir gary verity from welcome to yorkshire told me what 's in store :
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: 'be more resilient ' : york flood plan tells people to help protect their own homes
text: people in parts of york are being asked to do more to prevent their homes from flooding .
the council 's due to agree details today of a community flood resilience programme .
it includes more flood wardens , more local flood action plans , and teaching schoolchildren about the risks of flooding .
the councillor who oversees flooding protection in the city is andrew waller .
he says it 's all about individuals doing what they can to protect their homes :

documents.title: listen : inspired by leeds in the shower ?
text: leeds has been named as the most inspirational city in the country in a survey .
the results claimed people in leeds are three times more likely to feel inspired when out and about than at work .
the survey also says one in ten people in the city do most of their inspirational thinking in the bath or shower .
these people in leeds say there 's a lot to be proud of :

documents.title: watch : terminally ill doncaster woman 's wedding appeal
text: a woman from dunscroft in doncaster is getting married on saturday , but she is appealing for your help .
joaley boardman is dying of cancer , so her friends and neighbours have been organising a wedding for her .
but with two days to go they need some help getting the last few bits together the big day :

documents.title: calls for 'hillsborough law ' by families of 96 killed football fans
text: families of the 96 football fans who were unlawfully killed in the hillsborough disaster are calling for their `` hillsborough law '' to be brought in as soon as possible , to compel public officials to be truthful at inquiries .
it comes as former chief superintendent , david duckenfield , was yesterday charged with the manslaughter of 95 of the victims .
five others , including sir norman bettison , the former chief inspector of south yorkshire police , were also charged .
pete wetherby qc represents 22 of the hillsborough families .
he says the law would force people to `` come clean '' :

documents.title: watch : yorkshire 's thursday weather - more summer rain
text: rather cloudy , cool and damp , with a northerly breeze and spells of rain .
the rain becoming lighter and more intermittent as the day goes on .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: rspca warning to pack nets away
text: more animals needed rescuing from netting in north yorkshire during 2016 than almost anywhere else in the north of england .
there were 33 incidents in the area last year putting the county joint-top in the regional standings with greater manchester .
there were only five areas in the whole of england and wales where more animals were trapped by netting .
the rspca says these cases are often fatal and that football and tennis nets tend to be the main culprits .

documents.title: watch : millions expected to flock to yorkshire cycling event
text: yorkshire 's been named as the location for one of the most prestigious events on the road cycling calendar .
harrogate will be the main host town for the uci road world championships in 2019 .
all the events will end in the town , while doncaster , northallerton , ripon , leeds , beverley and york , will also see action over the nine-days as start locations .
the event is expected to attract a global television audience of more than 300 million people .

documents.title: more police in sheffield after gang fights
text: policing in part of sheffield has been stepped up to reassure the public after two stabbings and a shooting last week .
south yorkshire police says five extra officers have been drafted in to the burngreave area to deal with community tensions and crime .
they 'd already been given more powers to stop and search people , after a fight between somali and kurdish gangs there last wednesday .

documents.title: check your rail journey this morning
text: on the rails across yorkshire so far today , most services seem to be running pretty much to time except for the 07:23 from bradford interchange to leeds , which is posted as delayed .
meanwhile , you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: princess anne opens £ 28m hospital wing in bradford
text: a multi-million pound new hospital wing has been officially opened by princess anne .
the wing at bradford royal infirmary has two children 's wards , a 16-bed intensive care unit and dementia wards .
the princess royal met patients and staff as she toured the building .
the £ 28m wing is part of a £ 75m investment by bradford teaching hospitals nhs foundation trust to improve patient care .
the new wing provides 104 beds across the two elderly and two children 's wards .
it also has improved facilities for the family and carers of patients .

documents.title: yorkshire 's thursday weather
text: rather cloudy , cool and damp , with a northerly breeze , extensive low cloud and spells of rain .
the rain will be heaviest first thing , gradually becoming lighter and more intermittent as the day goes on , with winds falling light .
tonight it 'll remain generally cloudy and damp , with a little further rain .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police officers nominated for bravery award
text: two south yorkshire police officers , who were injured in a confrontation with a man wielding an axe have been nominated today for a national police bravery award .
pc lisa bates and pc mark garrett had responded to a report of an ongoing domestic incident in sheffield in april 2016 , where a man had been heard making threats to kill a woman .
they 'll find out if they 've won the award in july .
@ syptweet pcs lisa bates & mark garrett risked their lives to tackle an axeman .
nominated for # policebravery 2017
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: yorkshire host towns revealed for 2019 cycling world championships
text: after months of waiting , its finally been confirmed , yorkshire is to host one of the worlds most prestigious cycling events , the international cycling union road world championships .

harrogate has been named as the main competition town and finish location for each race and race start locations have been proposed in beverley , doncaster , leeds , northallerton , ripon , and york .
this is a huge event , second only to the tour de france in the terms of profile and importance .
yorkshire will probably need to brace itself for world-wide coverage , hundreds of journalists and tens of thousands of spectators .
the uci road world championships will see about 1,000 riders from 75 countries competing for the coveted rainbow jersey , organisers said .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage across yorkshire
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on thursday 29 june 2017 .
we 'll be with you throughout the day with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
there 's a bit more of the damp stuff due to fall from the sky today , but it 's not just us humans that try to dodge it and stay dry .
thanks to bbc weather watcher , dazzler , for this pic of a bedraggled blue tit .
if you snap anything interesting which you 'd like to share with the rest of yorkshire , you can send it in by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
